snp1.3:15.2: The exact nuance of this line is hard to pin down, and varies much in translation. Pali texts, however, always equate _abhilāpa_ with “naming”.
snp1.3:19.2: _Padumī_ is uncertain, see Bodhi’s note 475. But [other Sanskrit sources](https://books.google.com.au/books?id=99DgDwAAQBAJ&pg=PT101&lpg=PT101&dq=why+is+elephant+called+%22padmin%22&source=bl&ots=yjtYki1Aiw&sig=ACfU3U3b-nbKLRr9JB93iB_f0MRm29z45w&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwj317SinfXtAhUzwzgGHWzTCKoQ6AEwAXoECAIQAg#v=onepage&q=why%20is%20elephant%20called%20%22padmin%22&f=false) attribute the epithet to the elephant’s predeliction to bathing and eating in lotus ponds, which would seem much more likely. https://www.agefotostock.com/age/en/Stock-Images/Rights-Managed/D88-2815363
